intro: Achyrocline saturejoides, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a strong, aromatic scent. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
